alert.note: Alert for Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:40PM EDT until June 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN CHARLES CITY...EAST CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGE...SOUTHWESTERN JAMES CITY AND SURRY COUNTIES... At 740 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cabin Point, or near Claremont, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Elberon around 745 PM EDT. Surry around 750 PM EDT. Scotland around 755 PM EDT. Jamestown around 800 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Spring Grove, Taylors Corner, Gwaltney Corner, Oak Hill Corner, Carsley and Savedge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
